<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/california-drought-cause-wideranging-industry-problems?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Kim, There's Reservoirs That Are Drying
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/california-drought-cause-wideranging-industry-problems" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Drought in California" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDM2L2Ryb3VnaHRfaW5fY2FsaWZvcm5pYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Stephen Lam/The San Francisco Chronicle via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The latest shortage hitting the American West? <a href="https://apnews.com/article/california-droughts-government-and-politics-science-business-76709d5854394905e0f46880ed6dab9c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Water</a>. And while Chick-fil-A sauce and semiconductors are important for a functioning economy, this year's historic drought in the West could affect—and we do mean this—literally everything.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The state of play: </strong>California Gov. Gavin Newsom has put 41 counties under a state of emergency in an attempt to drastically limit water use. Some scientists say the region is facing the worst drought in centuries. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s getting hit the hardest?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Anyone who eats food</strong>. The water levels of 1,500+ reservoirs in California are 50% lower than normal at this time of year, per Jay Lund, co-director of the Center for Watershed Sciences at UC-Davis. This means huge cuts to the water that farmers in the state use to produce over 25% of the country's food supply. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Your morning breakfast of Blue Diamond almond milk and habanero BBQ almonds could be impacted. California accounts for 80% of the US' almond supply, but because of shrinking water allocations, some farmers are simply </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/drought-imperils-economy-in-californias-farm-country-11621589407?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bulldozing</a></span><span> those notoriously thirsty almond trees.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Anyone who uses electricity. </strong>Officials are predicting the water level of Lake Oroville, the Beyoncé of California lakes, to hit a record low in August. If that happens, they would need to shut down a major hydroelectric power plant, putting extra strain on the electrical grid during the hottest part of the summer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Anyone who is a fish</strong>. In April, California officials <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/apr/30/california-salmon-drought-truck-road?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> they'd be driving 146 truckloads of 15+ million young salmon to the Pacific Ocean because the fish wouldn't be able to swim in the dangerously shallow, warm waterways connecting the state’s Central Valley to the ocean.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Anyone who dislikes wildfires.</strong> <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/deadly-fires-california-have-claimed-least-30-lives-year-n1241632?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Five of the six</a> largest wildfires in modern California history happened during the 2020 wildfire season, killing 30+ people. Experts say the current conditions are much worse.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This drought could have devastating consequences for the state’s agriculture, wildlife preservation, and tourism industries. #BoatSummer in California is <a href="https://weather.com/photos/news/2021-06-02-houseboats-removed-oroville-lake-drought-california?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not looking good</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/united-airlines-cuts-deal-supersonic-commercial-jets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
These Planes Are Automatic, Supersonic, Hypnotic, Funky Fresh
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/united-airlines-cuts-deal-supersonic-commercial-jets" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Boom plane" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzM1L2Jvb21fcGxhbmUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Boom Supersonic</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cicadas aren't the only thing that return every ~17 years. The promise of supersonic commercial flight reemerged yesterday when United Airlines announced it's <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/3/22497462/united-airlines-boom-supersonic-deal-overture-jets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buying 15 jets</a> from Boom Supersonic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Supersonic = faster than the speed of sound. </strong>Boom's planes could cut flight times in half and get you from a bagel breakfast in NYC to teatime in London in 3.5 hours. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Catching a flight that quick hasn't been possible since 2003, when the iconic Concorde jet <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/gallery/2019/mar/08/50th-anniversary-of-concordes-maiden-flight-in-pictures?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">retired</a>. It was an expensive, gas-guzzling machine, and the loud booms it made while breaking the sound barrier woke up enough babies that Congress banned supersonic flights over US soil in the ’70s. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Now, Boom and other supersonic startups are </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/aerion-supersonic-planemaker-folds/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working on</a></span><span> net-zero emissions and noise-muffling tech. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>supersonic jets are largely in the development phase; Boom's never actually built a full-scale version of its Overture aircraft, and it'll need to clear regulatory checks before passengers hop onboard in 2029. Just last month, one of the leading supersonic jet makers, Aerion, <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/science/science-news/supersonic-airliners-hit-turbulence-jet-developer-shuts-rcna1044?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a> because of financial troubles and concerns about fuel-efficiency and noise regulations.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/twitter-launches-first-paid-subscription-service-blue?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Feeling Blue? Twitter's Got You
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At long last, Twitter <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/twitter-begins-rolling-out-subscription-product-undo-tweets-customize-app-2021-06-03/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has released</a> its first subscription product, Twitter Blue. For now, only Australian and Canadian users can pay around $3/month to access Blue features like a 30-second grace period to undo or edit a tweet before it's posted, prioritized customer support, Reader Mode for easier viewing of threads, and color scheme customization for the app.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not quite the "edit" button users have been begging for and nothing particularly groundbreaking. So...why are we writing about it? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investor pressure and advertising competition from the likes of Snapchat and Facebook <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/3/22464291/twitter-blue-subscription-service-canada-australia-undo-reader-mode?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushed</a> Twitter to look for new revenue streams. A subscription offering has been on the roadmap for years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Twitter's product team must have picked up a copy of <em>Deep Work </em>during the pandemic, because they've been testing and/or launching tons of new features including...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A virtual tip jar</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Super Follows" for individual users to charge subscriptions</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Voice-based DMs and tweets </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Features that limit the spread of misinformation and </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/05/06/994138707/want-to-send-a-mean-tweet-twitters-new-feature-wants-you-to-think-again?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Twitter%20Releases%20New%20Feature%20To%20Prompt%20Users%20To%20Reconsider%20Mean%20Tweets%20%3A%20NPR&text=Ethics-,Twitter%20Releases%20New%20Feature%20To%20Prompt%20Users%20To%20Reconsider%20Mean,review%20a%20message%20before%20sending." target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prevent harassment</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Stories (aka "Fleets")</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Spaces, a Clubhouse competitor</span></li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F03%2Ftwitter-launches-first-paid-subscription-service-blue" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Users+can+access+special+features+including+a+30-second+grace+period+to+undo+or+edit+a+tweet&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/twitter-launches-first-paid-subscription-service-blue&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F03%2Ftwitter-launches-first-paid-subscription-service-blue&title=Twitter+Launches+First+Paid+Subscription+Service%2C+Blue&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=Users+can+access+special+features+including+a+30-second+grace+period+to+undo+or+edit+a+tweet" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To top it off, <a href="https://app.adjust.com/4n9elbc?fallback=https%3A%2F%2Fpublic.com%2F%3Fyay%3D4n9elbc&redirect_macos=https%3A%2F%2Fpublic.com%2F%3Fyay%3D4n9elbc" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Public</a> also has <strong style="color:#000">live audio shows where knowledgeable commentators dish on the latest market news</strong>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/key-performance-indicators-june-4?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Babe Ruth's 1914 "pre-rookie" card was valued at <a href="https://theathletic.com/news/babe-ruths-1914-card-valued-at-over-6-million-sells-for-record-price/etdcm3ldhqEl?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $6 million</a>, becoming the most expensive trading card in history. And you can own it: The investing platform Collectable is selling 20,000 shares in the card for $3 a piece. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"We believe that recent volatility and our current market prices reflect market and trading dynamics unrelated to our underlying business."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a filing, AMC <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/meme-stocks-gyrate-after-amc-files-to-sell-more-shares-11622721750?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acknowledged</a> that the 2,900% jump in its share price this year was not (shocker) actually related to a miraculous turnaround for the movie theater industry. This warning, plus its plan to sell more than 11 million shares, resulted in an 18% drop for the day. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>America has a drinking problem. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2021/07/america-drinking-alone-problem/619017/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>)</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/prices-going-across-sectors?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Prices Are Going Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/prices-going-across-sectors" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Up Pixar" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzM0L3VwX3BpeGFyLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixar</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There was a distinct theme to business news headlines yesterday: Prices across sectors are growing at their fastest rates in years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Housing: </strong>Global housing prices <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-03/global-home-prices-rise-most-since-2006-fueling-bubble-concerns?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 7.3%</a> on average in the 12 months to March—the fastest pace since 2006, according to Knight Frank's Global House Price Index. The top five countries for price growth are 1) Turkey 2) New Zealand 3) Luxembourg 4) Slovakia and 5) the US. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shipping: </strong>The cost of moving a container from China to Dubai <a href="https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3135852/coronavirus-shipping-rates-stay-unprecedented-levels-until?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has ballooned</a> to $5,000 from $1,000 last year, according to SCMP. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Food: </strong>A UN food price index <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/8b5f4b4d-cbf8-4269-af2c-c94063197bbb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soared 40%</a> in May, the largest jump in a decade. Low-income countries will suffer the worst effects of this food inflation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Consumer goods: </strong>Prices across 36 mostly wealthy countries rose at their <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/inflation-in-rich-countries-hit-a-12-year-high-in-april-11622637522?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fastest pace</a> in more than 12 years during April. Economists are chalking up this eye-popping inflation to "base effects"—meaning these numbers only appear huge because they're being compared to last spring, when prices plummeted at the onset of the pandemic.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The feeling of getting a 5/5 on the Brew's Weekly News Quiz has been compared to scream-singing in your car.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's that satisfying. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/03/brews-weekly-news-quiz-june-4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ace the quiz</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Your dog throwing shade at you? </strong>Maybe because you're feeding your pooch highly-processed kibble or canned food when they should be <a href="https://sundaysfordogs.com/brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sp&utm_campaign=6.4.21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chowing down on Sundays</a>—the first (and only) human-grade, air-dried, zero-prep dog food. <a href="https://sundaysfordogs.com/brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sp&utm_campaign=6.4.21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get 35% off your first order with code BREW</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trailer roundup: </strong>M. Night Shyamalan <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A4U2pMRV9_k" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is back</a> and so is...<a href="https://twitter.com/paramountplus/status/1399780282505469952?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1399780282505469952%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnn.com%2F2021%2F06%2F02%2Fentertainment%2Ficarly-trailer-trnd%2Findex.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">iCarly</a>? Yep, get your spaghetti tacos ready.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow Friday: </strong>Today’s theme is...camping. Follow these Appalachian Trail <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@hikerhypehouse?lang=en" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thruhikers</a>, these <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@menwiththepot?lang=en&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fireside chefs</a> who will make your hot dogs look sad, and this uber-soothing <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/@oldtimehawkey/video/6915575956207914245?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESMgowSjc9v11kAgzQPTXBTMRSwJT5VB3PRhTEZNex56lKis49DuXz%2F4Za5aCqGMtHCiRTGgA%3D&_r=1&language=en&sec_uid=MS4wLjABAAAAHKZP9IzxUI9ZwPRY_tpr-Au4Nseen6D19yAZ5H828fxadAii_ycIe1JjtxOXtBhm&sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAAbQAYBK7c-ybxcIx87pN3dNd0ht8X6vL3SQM425UjM0Jtej9qiObylrhGoeIU7Ni4&share_app_id=1233&share_author_id=6811170282119595014&share_link_id=11459294-421F-4018-9FFE-599A57C83208&source=h5_m&tt_from=copy&u_code=d4dfc21k82809a&user_id=6653160904294842373&utm_campaign=client_share&utm_medium=ios&utm_source=copy&is_copy_url=1&is_from_webapp=v1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walk companion</a>. Gavin Newsom has put 41 counties under a state of emergency in an attempt to drastically limit water use. Some scientists say the region is facing the worst drought in centuries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho’s getting hit the hardest?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnyone who eats food\u003c/strong\u003e. The water levels of 1,500+ reservoirs in California are 50% lower than normal at this time of year, per Jay Lund, co-director of the Center for Watershed Sciences at UC-Davis. This means huge cuts to the water that farmers in the state use to produce over 25% of the country's food supply. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYour morning breakfast of Blue Diamond almond milk and habanero BBQ almonds could be impacted. California accounts for 80% of the US' almond supply, but because of shrinking water allocations, some farmers are simply \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/drought-imperils-economy-in-californias-farm-country-11621589407?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebulldozing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e those notoriously thirsty almond trees.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnyone who uses electricity. \u003c/strong\u003eOfficials are predicting the water level of Lake Oroville, the Beyoncé of California lakes, to hit a record low in August. If that happens, they would need to shut down a major hydroelectric power plant, putting extra strain on the electrical grid during the hottest part of the summer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnyone who is a fish\u003c/strong\u003e. In April, California officials \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/apr/30/california-salmon-drought-truck-road?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e they'd be driving 146 truckloads of 15+ million young salmon to the Pacific Ocean because the fish wouldn't be able to swim in the dangerously shallow, warm waterways connecting the state’s Central Valley to the ocean.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnyone who dislikes wildfires.\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/deadly-fires-california-have-claimed-least-30-lives-year-n1241632?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFive of the six\u003c/a\u003e largest wildfires in modern California history happened during the 2020 wildfire season, killing 30+ people. Experts say the current conditions are much worse.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis drought could have devastating consequences for the state’s agriculture, wildlife preservation, and tourism industries. #BoatSummer in California is \u003ca href=\"https://weather.com/photos/news/2021-06-02-houseboats-removed-oroville-lake-drought-california?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot looking good\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCicadas aren't the only thing that return every ~17 years. The promise of supersonic commercial flight reemerged yesterday when United Airlines announced it's \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/3/22497462/united-airlines-boom-supersonic-deal-overture-jets?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuying 15 jets\u003c/a\u003e from Boom Supersonic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSupersonic = faster than the speed of sound. \u003c/strong\u003eBoom's planes could cut flight times in half and get you from a bagel breakfast in NYC to teatime in London in 3.5 hours. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCatching a flight that quick hasn't been possible since 2003, when the iconic Concorde jet \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/gallery/2019/mar/08/50th-anniversary-of-concordes-maiden-flight-in-pictures?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eretired\u003c/a\u003e. It was an expensive, gas-guzzling machine, and the loud booms it made while breaking the sound barrier woke up enough babies that Congress banned supersonic flights over US soil in the ’70s. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNow, Boom and other supersonic startups are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/aerion-supersonic-planemaker-folds/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworking on\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e net-zero emissions and noise-muffling tech. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003esupersonic jets are largely in the development phase; Boom's never actually built a full-scale version of its Overture aircraft, and it'll need to clear regulatory checks before passengers hop onboard in 2029. Just last month, one of the leading supersonic jet makers, Aerion, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/science/science-news/supersonic-airliners-hit-turbulence-jet-developer-shuts-rcna1044?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e because of financial troubles and concerns about fuel-efficiency and noise regulations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F03%2Funited-airlines-cuts-deal-supersonic-commercial-jets\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Twitter's Got You\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt long last, Twitter \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/twitter-begins-rolling-out-subscription-product-undo-tweets-customize-app-2021-06-03/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas released\u003c/a\u003e its first subscription product, Twitter Blue. For now, only Australian and Canadian users can pay around $3/month to access Blue features like a 30-second grace period to undo or edit a tweet before it's posted, prioritized customer support, Reader Mode for easier viewing of threads, and color scheme customization for the app.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot quite the \"edit\" button users have been begging for and nothing particularly groundbreaking. So...why are we writing about it? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestor pressure and advertising competition from the likes of Snapchat and Facebook \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/3/22464291/twitter-blue-subscription-service-canada-australia-undo-reader-mode?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epushed\u003c/a\u003e Twitter to look for new revenue streams. A subscription offering has been on the roadmap for years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eTwitter's product team must have picked up a copy of \u003cem\u003eDeep Work \u003c/em\u003eduring the pandemic, because they've been testing and/or launching tons of new features style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 7.3%\u003c/a\u003e on average in the 12 months to March—the fastest pace since 2006, according to Knight Frank's Global House Price Index. The top five countries for price growth are 1) Turkey 2) New Zealand 3) Luxembourg 4) Slovakia and 5) the US. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShipping: \u003c/strong\u003eThe cost of moving a container from China to Dubai \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3135852/coronavirus-shipping-rates-stay-unprecedented-levels-until?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas ballooned\u003c/a\u003e to $5,000 from $1,000 last year, according to SCMP. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFood: \u003c/strong\u003eA UN food price index \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/8b5f4b4d-cbf8-4269-af2c-c94063197bbb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoared 40%\u003c/a\u003e in May, the largest jump in a decade. Low-income countries will suffer the worst effects of this food inflation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConsumer goods: \u003c/strong\u003ePrices across 36 mostly wealthy countries rose at their \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/inflation-in-rich-countries-hit-a-12-year-high-in-april-11622637522?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efastest pace\u003c/a\u003e in more than 12 years during April. Economists are chalking up this eye-popping inflation to \"base effects\"—meaning these numbers only appear huge because they're being compared to last spring, when prices plummeted at the onset of
